item.title: How to load data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe in Python
item.description: Here is the way of building connections between SQL Server and Python. Then import data from SQL Server to Pandas Dataframe. import pyodbc import pandas as pd conn = pyodbc.connect('Driver={SQL Server};' 'Server=localhost;' 'Database=DataBase;' 'Trusted_Connection=yes;') query = "select * from DataBase.dbo.annual_demand" df = pd.read_sql(query, conn) conn.close()

item.title: How to reset R environment
item.description: As part of best practice, cleaning the R environment before running the code is suggested. The following code will remove all variables and unload all libraries. # Clear environment of variables and functions rm(list = ls(all = TRUE)) # Clear environmet of packages if(is.null(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs) == FALSE)lapply(paste("package:", names(sessionInfo()$otherPkgs), sep=""), detach, character.only = TRUE, unload = TRUE)

item.title: How to count NULLs with SQL and R
item.description: When representing no values, NULL and NA are used in SQL and R, respectively. Be careful that NULL in R is not the same one as NULL in SQL. Using SQL select count(*) [Number of Null Salaries] from EmP where Salary is NULL Using base R # load the data into dataframe install.packages("RODBC") library(RODBC) conn <- odbcConnect("localhost") Emp <- sqlQuery(conn,"select * from capstone.dbo.Emp") numNAs <- apply(is.na(Emp),2,sum) ratiosNulls <- numNAs/nrow(Emp) ratiosNulls # don't forget to close the connection odbcClose(conn)

item.title: How to randomly sample the data from a table
item.description: If your table is too large for effective processing, you may want to use a randomly selected subset of data from your original table. Example code: USE AdventureWorks2012 ; GO select count(*) from Person.Person SELECT FirstName, LastName FROM Person.Person TABLESAMPLE (10 PERCENT); Data Source: https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms189108(v=sql.105).aspx

item.title: Code - Remove Duplicate Files in the Folder
item.description: This code helps me remove duplicate files, ending with -copy in the folder. import os arr = os.listdir() target = [] for i in arr: if "- Copy.JPG" in i or "- Copy.jpg" in i or "- Copy.heic" in i or "- Copy.BMP" in i or "- Copy.PNG" in i or "- Copy.png" in i: target.append(i) for t in target: os.remove(t)
